type.name: event_item
type.description: This select is a place holder for assignments of event to elements of product data.

type.name: event_organization_or_person_in_organization_item
type.description: This select extends the assignments of an organization or a person in an organization to Event.

type.name: event_date_or_date_time_item
type.description: This select is a extends the assignments of a date or a date and time to Event.

entity.name: Event
entity.description: An Event is the fact of the existence of a state at some point in time. The point in time of an event may not be known.

explicit.name: id
explicit.description: the identification of the event assigned by the organization.

explicit.name: name
explicit.description: words by which the event is known.

inverse.name: identifer
inverse.description: the organization (or person in an organization) that assigned and owns the event id.

inverse.name: planned_date
inverse.description: the optional date and/ or time when the event is planned to occur.

inverse.name: actual_date
inverse.description: the optional date and/ or time when the event occured.

entity.name: Event_assignment
entity.description: An Event_assignment assigns an Event to product data.

explicit.name: assigned_event
explicit.description: the Event to be assigned to product data.

explicit.name: items
explicit.description: the product data to which the Event is assigned.

entity.name: Event_relationship
entity.description: An Event_relationship specifies that two events are related. This is a foundation concept which may be refined in other modules. This concept can be used to define sequencing.

explicit.name: relation_type
explicit.description: an optional type descriptor for the relationship.

explicit.name: description
explicit.description: an optional description of the relationship.

explicit.name: event1
explicit.description: the Event to be related to event2.

explicit.name: event2
explicit.description: the Event to be related to event1.

entity.name: Relative_event
entity.description: A Relative_event is an Event that takes place at a time offset from the time that another Event takes place.

explicit.name: related_event
explicit.description: the Event this Event is based on.

explicit.name: offset
explicit.description: the difference in time between the two events.
